French.title: Coq au Vin
ingredients: 4 large chicken thighs, bone-in and skin-on
French.instructions: In a large Dutch oven, cook bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove bacon and set aside. Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper. Brown chicken in bacon fat until golden on all sides, about 5-6 minutes per side. Remove chicken and set aside. In the same pot, sauté onions and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Return chicken and bacon to pot. Add wine, stock, bay leaves, and thyme. Bring to simmer, cover, and cook for 1 hour. Add mushrooms and pearl onions, cook for additional 15 minutes. Remove bay leaves and thyme sprigs. Serve hot with crusty bread.

French.title: Bouillabaisse
ingredients: 1kg mixed fish (red snapper, sea bass, monkfish)
Salt and black pepper to taste
French.instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté onions, fennel, and garlic until softened, about 8 minutes. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, orange zest, lemon zest, bay leaves, fennel seeds, and saffron. Cook for 2 minutes. Add fish stock and white wine, bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add fish pieces and cook for 5 minutes. Add mussels and clams, cook until shells open, about 3-4 minutes. Discard any unopened shells. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with rouille sauce and crusty bread.

French.title: Ratatouille Niçoise
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
French.instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Salt eggplant slices and let drain for 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry. In a large baking dish, layer vegetables in alternating pattern: eggplant, zucchini, tomatoes, peppers. Sprinkle onions and garlic between layers. Drizzle with olive oil and season with herbs, salt, and pepper. Add bay leaf. Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes. Remove foil and bake for additional 15 minutes until vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized. Serve warm or at room temperature.

French.title: Beef Bourguignon
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
French.instructions: In a large Dutch oven, cook bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove bacon and set aside. Season beef with salt and pepper. Brown beef in bacon fat in batches until golden on all sides. Remove beef and set aside. Sauté onions, carrots, and garlic until softened, about 8 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Return beef and bacon to pot. Add wine, stock, bay leaves, thyme, and peppercorns. Bring to simmer, cover, and cook for 2-3 hours until beef is tender. Add mushrooms and pearl onions, cook for additional 15 minutes. Remove bay leaves and thyme sprigs. Serve hot with mashed potatoes or crusty bread.

French.title: Quiche Lorraine
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
French.instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook bacon in a skillet until crispy. Remove bacon and set aside. In the same skillet, sauté onions until softened, about 5 minutes. In a bowl, whisk together eggs, cream, milk, cheese, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Place pie crust in a 9-inch pie dish. Sprinkle bacon and onions over the crust. Pour egg mixture over the top. Bake for 35-40 minutes until center is set and top is golden brown. Let cool for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

Italian.title: Osso Buco alla Milanese
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Italian.instructions: Season veal shanks with salt and pepper, then dredge in flour. Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Brown veal shanks on all sides until golden, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove and set aside. Sauté onions, carrots, celery, and garlic until softened, about 8 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Return veal to pot. Add wine, stock, bay leaves, thyme, and rosemary. Bring to simmer, cover, and cook for 2-3 hours until meat is very tender. Remove bay leaves and thyme sprigs. Serve hot with risotto alla Milanese and gremolata.

Italian.title: Risotto ai Porcini
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Italian.instructions: Soak dried porcini mushrooms in warm water for 30 minutes. Drain and reserve the liquid. Finely chop the mushrooms. Heat olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter in a large pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add rice and stir for 2 minutes until translucent. Add wine and stir until absorbed. Add mushrooms and their soaking liquid. Gradually add warm stock, one ladle at a time, stirring constantly until each addition is absorbed. Continue until rice is creamy and al dente, about 18-20 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in remaining butter and Parmesan. Season with salt and pepper. Let rest for 2 minutes before serving.

Italian.title: Saltimbocca alla Romana
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Italian.instructions: Place a slice of prosciutto and 2 sage leaves on each veal cutlet. Secure with toothpicks. Season with salt and pepper, then dredge in flour. Heat butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook veal cutlets prosciutto-side down for 2-3 minutes until golden. Flip and cook for additional 1-2 minutes. Remove cutlets and set aside. Add wine to skillet and deglaze, scraping up browned bits. Add stock and lemon juice, simmer for 2-3 minutes until slightly reduced. Return cutlets to skillet and cook for 1 minute to heat through. Remove toothpicks and serve hot with sauce and lemon wedges.

Italian.title: Penne all'Arrabbiata
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Italian.instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook penne according to package directions until al dente. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté garlic and chili peppers until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and tomato paste, breaking up tomatoes with a spoon. Simmer for 15-20 minutes until sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Drain pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. Add pasta to sauce along with basil and a splash of pasta water if needed. Toss well and serve hot with grated Pecorino Romano.

Italian.title: Tiramisu
Italian.instructions: In a large bowl, whisk egg yolks and sugar until pale and thick. Add mascarpone and whisk until smooth. In a separate bowl, whip cream until stiff peaks form. Gently fold whipped cream into mascarpone mixture. In a shallow dish, combine espresso and coffee liqueur. Quickly dip each ladyfinger in the coffee mixture and arrange in a single layer in a 9x13-inch dish. Spread half the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers. Repeat with another layer of dipped ladyfingers and remaining mascarpone mixture. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Before serving, dust with cocoa powder and garnish with chocolate shavings.

Spanish.title: Paella Valenciana
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Spanish.instructions: Heat olive oil in a large paella pan over medium-high heat. Season chicken and rabbit with salt and pepper. Brown meat on all sides until golden, about 8-10 minutes. Remove and set aside. Sauté onion and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add grated tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add green beans and lima beans, cook for 3 minutes. Return meat to pan. Add rice and stir for 1 minute. Add hot stock, saffron, and rosemary. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to medium-low. Cook without stirring for 18-20 minutes until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Let rest for 5 minutes before serving with lemon wedges.

Spanish.title: Gazpacho Andaluz
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Spanish.instructions: Soak bread in water for 10 minutes, then squeeze out excess water. In a blender, combine tomatoes, cucumber, peppers, onion, garlic, vinegar, olive oil, and soaked bread. Blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve if desired for a smoother texture. Chill in refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Serve cold with ice cubes and garnish with diced cucumber and tomato.

Spanish.title: Tortilla Española
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Spanish.instructions: Heat olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes and onions, cook until potatoes are tender but not browned, about 15-20 minutes. Drain potatoes and onions, reserving oil. In a large bowl, beat eggs with salt and pepper. Add potatoes and onions to eggs, mix gently. Heat 2 tablespoons of reserved oil in the same skillet over medium heat. Pour egg mixture into skillet. Cook until bottom is set, about 5 minutes. Carefully flip tortilla using a large plate. Cook for additional 3-5 minutes until fully set. Slide onto serving plate and let cool slightly before slicing.

Spanish.title: Pulpo a la Gallega
Spanish.instructions: Clean octopus and remove beak and eyes. In a large pot, bring water to boil with bay leaves, onion, and garlic. Add octopus and simmer for 45-60 minutes until tender. Remove octopus and let cool slightly. Cut tentacles into 1-inch pieces. Arrange on a serving plate. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with paprika and sea salt. Garnish with parsley and serve with lemon wedges.

Spanish.title: Churros con Chocolate
Spanish.instructions: In a medium saucepan, bring water, butter, and salt to boil. Remove from heat and add flour all at once. Stir vigorously until mixture forms a ball. Let cool for 5 minutes. Beat in eggs one at a time until smooth. Heat oil to 375°F (190°C). Transfer dough to a pastry bag fitted with a star tip. Pipe 4-inch strips into hot oil. Fry until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Mix sugar and cinnamon, roll churros in mixture. For chocolate sauce, melt chocolate with cream and honey until smooth. Serve churros hot with chocolate sauce for dipping.
